abstract.shortdesc: The standard comprises the definition of an API called Cryptoki (from cryptographic token interface). However, the term is often used instead, to refer to the API as well as to the standard that defines it. in turn is an open source implementation of Cryptoki. As such, provides a standard programming interface between applications and all kinds of portable cryptographic devices.

conbody.p:
consists of an implementation of the
Cryptoki API, a slot manager, a set of slot token dynamic link libraries (STDLLs), and an API for these STDLLs. For example, the type is a STDLL introduced with version 3.1.
provides support for several cryptographic algorithms according to the standard. The library loads the tokens that provide hardware or software specific support for cryptographic functions.
can be used directly through the shared library (C API) from all applications which are written in a language that provides a foreign language interface for C.
is available for major distributions, for example, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, SUSE Linux Enterprise Server, or Ubuntu.
